instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power, and only 5V on ampmeter.

It had bit of water contact on the right side, and doesn't power on.

After a quick check, I notice that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was shorted, and there was a bit corrosion on <CHIP>U9580</CHIP>. After removing <CHIP>U9580</CHIP> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is gone, and have 20V on ampmeter, and 0.27A, but still no power on.

<SIGNAL>P2V5_SW2_TPS62180_SSD0</SIGNAL> (on L9581) has 0.001 on diode reading, but I don't  know if it is because I've removed <CHIP>U9580</CHIP>.

Can you help?

I don't have any other <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board to replace <CHIP>U9580</CHIP>.

Can I use other mac board model to get this <CHIP>U9580</CHIP>?

TKS

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: At least one NAND is dead now...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi,

Is there any way to be sure that it is a NAND and not some other component?

Can I inject 1V there?

If it is a NAND is it possible to know witch one it is, and replace it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: You can start injecting 1V; no more than 3V there.
